codelist.label: Ergänzende Vorschrift
codelist.definition: Arten von Auflagen und Beschränkungen in räumlichen Plänen

value.label: impact on environment
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to the impact on the environment as defined by a competent authority and reported in the spatial plan

value.label: noise management zone
value.definition: An area where measures have been established to mitigate noise pollution.

value.label: noise protection area
value.definition: area inside which specific measure regarding the protection against noise are enacted

value.label: emission control area
value.definition: An area where measures have been established to control air pollution.

value.label: air quality management zone
value.definition: Part of the territory of a Member State, as delimited by that Member State for the purposes of air quality assessment and management.

value.label: renewable energy area
value.definition: area suitable for renewable energy

value.label: nature protection
value.definition: area which relates to the protection of nature

value.label: ecological corridor
value.definition: area of habitat connecting wildlife populations separated by human activities (such as roads, development, or logging)

value.label: biodiversity reservoir
value.definition: geographic area with a significant reservoir of biodiversity that is under threat from humans

value.label: protected wooded area
value.definition: wooded area that is protected

value.label: protected urban periurban agricultural or natural area
value.definition: Agricultural or Natural Area in Urban or peri-urban space which is protected

value.label: protected wetland
value.definition: area where the main factor of influence on habitat and its biota is waterland which is protected

value.label: plant health protection zone
value.definition: Protection zone within which protective measures are established against the introduction of organisms harmful to plants or plant products and against their spread.

value.label: other nature protection area
value.definition: area which relates to the protection of nature of other type

value.label: climate protection
value.definition: An area where measures have been established to mitigate climate change effects.

value.label: water protection
value.definition: An area where measures have been established to protect water

value.label: designated waters
value.definition: Marine, coastal or surface waters designated by Member States as needing protection or improvement in order to support fish life.

value.label: nitrate vulnerable zone
value.definition: Areas of land which drain into polluted or threatened waters and which contribute to nitrate pollution.

value.label: sensitive area
value.definition: Sensitive areas are surface waters (freshwater, estuaries and coastal waters) that require protection against eutrophication.

value.label: bathing waters
value.definition: Coastal waters or inland waters (rivers, lakes) explicitly authorised, or not prohibited for recreational bathing by large numbers of people.

value.label: drinking water protection area
value.definition: Area in which waste water leakage, use of fertilizer or pesticides, or establishment of waste disposal sites are prohibited.

value.label: forest management area
value.definition: Area designated for the sustainable management of forest resources and functions.

value.label: other impact on environment
value.definition: supplementary regulation of other type related to the impact on the environment as defined by a competent authority and reported in the spatial plan

value.label: risk exposure
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to the exposure to risk of any nature as defined by a competent authority and reported in the spatial plan

value.label: flood risks
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to the exposure to Flood

value.label: area exposed to flood risk
value.definition: area which is defined as exposed to flood risks

value.label: flood risk management zone
value.definition: Coastal areas or individual river basins assigned as the unit of management established for the assessment and management of flood risk.

value.label: industrial risk
value.definition: area at risk of dangerous material exposure

value.label: lead
value.definition: area at risk of lead exposure

value.label: restricted zones around contaminated sites
value.definition: Zones established to protect human, plant and animal health and control movement and development within a contaminated site.

value.label: brownfield land
value.definition: Brownfield land is land previously used for industrial purposes or certain commercial uses and that may be contaminated by low concentrations of hazardous waste or pollution and has the potential to be re-used once it is cleaned up4. Sometimes, the concept of brownfield land is also used for designating areas which were previously developed and have become obsolete, but are not necessarily contaminated.

value.label: exclusion area around seveso sites
value.definition: area within a regulatory distance from a site classified as Seveso

value.label: mining
value.definition: area which is defined as exposed to mining risks

value.label: erosion
value.definition: area which is defined as exposed to erosion risks.

value.label: other risk exposure
value.definition: area defined by other type of risk exposure.

value.label: heritage protection
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to any heritage protection be it natural, landscape or built up, as defined by a competent authority and reported in the spatial plan

value.label: natural heritage protection
value.definition: surrounding of an area protected due to its natural heritage importance

value.label: biodiversity protection
value.definition: including flora and fauna, scientifically known as biodiversity,

value.label: geodiversity protection
value.definition: including mineralogical, geomorphological, paleontological, etc., scientifically known as geodiversity.

value.label: landscape area protection
value.definition: area in which the landscape is protected,

value.label: built heritage protection
value.definition: surrounding of any protected monument within which the building rights are restricted

value.label: archeological protection
value.definition: surrounding of an archaeological site within which the building rights are restricted

value.label: other heritage protection
value.definition: other supplementary regulation that relates to heritage protection.

value.label: general interest
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to the general interest such as easements, as defined by a competent authority and reported in the spatial plan

value.label: public easement
value.definition: An easement is a certain right to use the real property of another or to restrict the use of a real property without possessing it. The rights of an easement holder vary substantially among jurisdictions. A public easement grants an easement for a public use or for the general interest

value.label: airport easement
value.definition: area around airports where constructability is restricted for safety reason (clearance of obstacle for take-off and landing)

value.label: railroad easement
value.definition: right-of-way as a strip of land that is granted, through an easement, for the purposes of maintenance or expansion of existing services

value.label: utility easement
value.definition: strip of land that is granted, through an easement, where constructability is restricted for safety of maintenance reason

value.label: rain water easement
value.definition: An easement to carry rainwater to a river, wetland, detention pond, or other body of water.

value.label: sanitary sewer easement
value.definition: An easement to carry used water to a sewage treatment plant.

value.label: electrical power line easement
value.definition: An easement related to the high voltage electrical network

value.label: telephone line easement
value.definition: An easement related to the telephone network

value.label: radio electrical easement
value.definition: An easement restricting the constructability around Radio-electrical devices in order to avoid radio masks or radio interference

value.label: fuel gas pipe easement
value.definition: an easement related to the security around gas-lines or pipelines

value.label: beach access
value.definition: Some jurisdictions permit residents to access a public lake or beach by crossing adjacent private property. Similarly, there may be a private easement to cross a private lake to reach a remote private property, or an easement to cross private property during high tide to reach remote beach property on foot.

value.label: conservation easement
value.definition: Grants rights to a land trust to limit development in order to protect the environment.

value.label: historic preservation easement
value.definition: Similar to the conservation easement, typically grants rights to a historic preservation organization to enforce restrictions on alteration of a historic building's exterior or interior.

value.label: other public easement
value.definition: Other supplementary regulation related to a public easement

value.label: other easement
value.definition: other supplementary regulation that relates to easements.

value.label: other reserved areas serving general interest
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to the general interest other than easements, as defined by a competent authority and reported in the spatial plan

value.label: land property right
value.definition: supplementary regulation related that affect the right of the owner regarding its land properties, as defined in the spatial plan

value.label: usable building area
value.definition: permissible built area of a lot/plot

value.label: area reserved for pre empting parcels
value.definition: Area defined in the spatial plan where the local government define a �Right of first refusal� (ROFR or RFR) that gives him the option to enter a business transaction with the owner of a property before the owner is entitled to enter into that transaction with a third party.

value.label: area reserved for restructuring parcels
value.definition: Reorganization of land holdings or subdivisions in a plan area as designated on a legally-binding plan for the redistribution of developed or undeveloped [p]lots of land such that their shape and size comply with future land development or rezoning.

value.label: reconstruction areas
value.definition: Sectors where the issuance of building permits may be subject to the demolition of all or part of the existing buildings on the land where the implementation of the construction is planned

value.label: stand by land resources
value.definition: Lands affected by the location of future infrastructures

value.label: other land property right
value.definition: Other supplementary regulation that relates to a land property

value.label: regulations on buildings
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to restriction and guidance on buildings (e.g. area where height limitation are imposed near airports, area where density ratio over land parcel is limited), as defined by the competent authority responsible for the spatial plan and reported in the spatial plan

value.label: building line
value.definition: Any new buildings must be placed behind the line determined by the alignment plan. If the owner built or rebuilt a house or boundary wall, it must respect the alignment.

value.label: boundary line
value.definition: perimeter adjacent to infrastructure

value.label: spatial design
value.definition: Area where buildings have to conform to spatial design guidance

value.label: secondary structure area
value.definition: spaces for secondary structures which are required in accordance with other regulations on the use of land, such as play, leisure and recreational areas, and car-parking spaces, garages and drive-ways

value.label: collective facility
value.definition: Constraints intended to promote a social life at the group home to which they are incorporated.

value.label: building height regulation
value.definition: Area where buildings have to conform to height guidance

value.label: building density regulation
value.definition: Area where buildings have to conform to density guidance

value.label: minimum housing size
value.definition: area with minimum size of housing

value.label: other regulations on buildings
value.definition: other supplementary regulation that relates to buildings

value.label: local regional state development policies
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to local/regional/state spatial development policies (e.g. area reserved for the construction of road infrastructures development axes, central places / population growth center, suitable area for development,...) as defined by a competent authority and reported in the spatial plan

value.label: settlement structure
value.definition: Settlement structure is the quantitative and qualitative pattern of distribution of housing, places of work, and infrastructure within a certain area.

value.label: central places
value.definition: The central-place classificatory system is an important tool in state and regional planning, and is laid down in spatial structure plans. In addition to supplying the needs of its own population, a central place performs service and development functions for the population of its catchment area. The central place system constitutes a hierarchy of basic, lower-order or small centres, middle-order centres, and high-order centres as determined at the different levels of state spatial planning. Some states insert intermediate categories in the hierarchy. Depending on their assignment to a central place, catchment areas are defined as local, intermediate or extended areas.

value.label: basic
value.definition: basic centres supplying the basic daily needs of the population and providing a minimum of public and private infrastructure

value.label: lower order centre
value.definition: The lowest level in the hierarchy is occupied by basic centres (low-order centres, small centres) with a local catchment area. They are designated in regional plans, and their functions include supplying the basic daily needs of the population and providing a minimum of public and private infrastructure (general secondary school, doctor, chemist, tradesmen, etc.).

value.label: middle order centre
value.definition: Middle-order centres are central places that meet more demanding, medium-term needs of the population in the intermediate catchment area (secondary schools leading to university entrance, hospitals, a variety of shopping amenities, etc.), and are designated by state spatial planning. They are also labour-market centres for their catchment area.

value.label: high order centre
value.definition: High-order centres are also designated by state spatial planning and meet demanding, specialised requirements of the population in the extended catchment area (technical colleges / universities, specialised clinics, large department stores, etc.). High-order centres also have a greater supply of highly qualified and skilled labour.

value.label: axes
value.definition: Important elements in spatial planning, axes are constituted by a concentration of transport and supply routes (linear infrastructure) and a relatively close succession of development centres and central places.

value.label: settlement axes
value.definition: Settlement axes are axes in agglomerations formed by a close succession of settlements along the routes of existing or planned public transport services.

value.label: supralocal axes
value.definition: Supralocal axes connect differently ranking central places and offer locational advantages at transport interchanges or nodes. Supralocal axes are national or European communication axes.

value.label: assignment of functions
value.definition: Tasks assigned specifically to individual municipalities or regions by state spatial planning are referred to as functions. The aim is the functional/structural (or spatial/functional) division of responsibilities and labour among component territorial entities.

value.label: housing
value.definition: Housing is an adequate complex of premises, an isolated room, a shelter, an apartment or a private house for permanent living

value.label: commerce industry
value.definition: commerce and industry key functions associated with municipalities or regions on regional or state level planning

value.label: services
value.definition: service key functions associated with municipalities or regions on regional or state level planning

value.label: tourism
value.definition: tourism key functions associated with municipalities or regions on regional or state level planning

value.label: agriculture
value.definition: agriculture key functions associated with municipalities or regions on regional or state level planning

value.label: forestry
value.definition: forestry functions key associated with municipalities or regions on regional or state level planning

value.label: business park
value.definition: area of land in which many office and commercial buildings are grouped together5. Business parks are groupings of tertiary activities and differ from industrial parks (manufacturing activities) or technology parks (research and technological development activities).

value.label: technopole
value.definition: (also called technology centre, technology park or science park) areas where numerous private and public activities pertaining to research and development, technological development, technology transfer, high-level scientific education, high-tech manufacturing activities and services, etc. are concentrated. In numerous cases, technopoles encompass one or several specialised cluster(s) of high-tech enterprises, incubators for startups, a business and innovation centre, consultancy clusters.

value.label: harbor activities
value.definition: harbor key functions associated with municipalities or regions on regional or state level planning

value.label: airport activities
value.definition: airport key functions associated with municipalities or regions on regional or state level planning

value.label: spatial order categories
value.definition: Spatial order categories are areas defined in terms of specific criteria in which comparable structures exist and where similar spatial planning goals are pursued.

value.label: rural area
value.definition: sparsely settled areas without significant large city or town. The countryside refers to certain forms of landscapes and land uses where agriculture and natural areas play an important part.

value.label: rural development pole
value.definition: an inhabited, significantly rural area where the social, economic and territorial evolutions are led within the framework of an integrated and prospective development plan. A rural pole is not an agglomeration, but a rural territory as a whole, which may include one or more small towns. The territorial development plan determines the objectives of results in short, medium and long terms. It specifies the guidelines for development, the human and material means to achieve the results targeted. The civil society, public and private actors must be partner for its development and its assessment

value.label: city and outer conurbation area
value.definition: aggregation or continuous network of urban communities which have physically merged through population growth and expansion. It is a polycentric form of agglomeration

value.label: urban area
value.definition: area which physically forms part of a town or city and is characterised by an important share of built-up surfaces, high density of population and employment and significant amounts of transport and other infrastructure (as opposed to rural areas). Urban areas may also comprise non built-up, green areas generally used for recreational purposes by urban dwellers.

value.label: metropolitan area
value.definition: a settlement system consisting of a large city (together with its suburbs) and its adjacent zones of influence, which may comprise various urban centres of different sizes. These adjacent zones are generally the so-called commuter belt. Interstitial open spaces also form part of the metropolitan area.

value.label: functional urban area
value.definition: area of influence of a city. It is generally delineated on the basis of statistics (for instance commuter flows). Most European States have definitions of Functional Urban Areas or similar concepts, such as travel to-work-areas, commuting catchment areas, commuting zones or functional urban regions. In the context of the ESPON I Programme, an attempt has been made to produce an identification and delineation of functional urban areas (FUA) at European level, using a harmonised statistical definition.

value.label: peri urban areas
value.definition: areas that are in some form of transition from strictly rural to urban. These areas often form the immediate urban-rural interface and may eventually evolve into being fully urban. Peri-urban areas are places where people are key components: they are lived-in environments.

value.label: polycentric spatial structure
value.definition: A polycentric spatial structure refers to the morphology of the settlement system. It assumes that a plurality of urban agglomerations of similar size exist at the various levels of the urban hierarchy, as opposed to situations where a single large urban centre dominates each level and even eliminates the presence of intermediary levels. The principle of polycentric spatial structure can be applied at the various geographical scales, from the European to the regional one.

value.label: eurocorridor or pan european corridor
value.definition: category of space of linear nature connecting large agglomerations over various national borders. They are areas of rapid and large-scale spatial dynamics within a Europe of vanishing national borders. Four interrelated dimensions can be distinguished in Eurocorridors: infrastructure and transport (mainly the Trans-European Networks), urbanisation, economic development and environmental sustainability.

value.label: spatial development projects
value.definition: Area for projects generated or controlled by public bodies which contribute positively to territorial development at different scales. Spatial development projects may comprise infrastructure works, the economic promotion and development of specific areas, urban rehabilitation measures, the restoration of damaged ecosystems, etc.

value.label: other settlement structure development policies
value.definition: other supplementary regulation that relates to settlement structure development policies

value.label: open space structure
value.definition: The term open-space structure refers to the quantitative and qualitative pattern or distribution of land uses and functions in a near-natural state.

value.label: agriculture
value.definition: open space assigned to agriculture

value.label: forest
value.definition: open space assigned to forest

value.label: recreation
value.definition: leisure, recreation and other outdoor activities

value.label: tourism
value.definition: open space assigned to tourism

value.label: green belt
value.definition: land use designation to retain areas of largely undeveloped, wild, or agricultural land surrounding or neighbouring urban areas. Similar concepts are greenways or green wedges which have a linear character and may run through an urban area instead of around it. In essence, a green belt is an invisible line encircling a certain area, preventing development of the area allowing wildlife to return and be established.

value.label: green break
value.definition: Green breaks or divides are smaller protected open spaces areas close to settlements to be kept free of development for local recreational purposes and in order to break up densely built-up areas. Green breaks should link up with the open countryside and act as a climatic corridor and habitat, as both refuge and exchange area for plants and animals.

value.label: raw materials
value.definition: open space assigned to prospection or dumping of material

value.label: prospecting and mining permit area
value.definition: The area on which the prospection or extraction of any mineral has been authorised and for which that right or permit is granted.

value.label: area for dumping of waste
value.definition: Area affected by uncontrolled disposal of waste as defined in Waste Framework Directive (2006/12/EC) Art 4.( from AM DS V2.0)�

value.label: recultivation
value.definition: open space assigned to recultivation

value.label: water
value.definition: water in open space

value.label: other open space structures
value.definition: Other supplementary regulation that relates to open space structures

value.label: coastal zone management area
value.definition: "Area in which ""integrated coastal zone management"" takes place."

value.label: infrastructure
value.definition: "technical structures that support a society, such as roads, water supply, sewers, electrical grids, telecommunications, and so forth, and can be defined as ""the physical components of interrelated systems providing commodities and services essential to enable, sustain, or enhance societal living conditions."

value.label: network
value.definition: the infrastructure and installations for transfer of goods

value.label: road
value.definition: by road

value.label: rail road
value.definition: by rail

value.label: water infrastructure
value.definition: by navigable water

value.label: other network infrastructure
value.definition: by other mean such as powerlines, pipelines�

value.label: regulated fairway at sea or large inland water
value.definition: Regulated navigation areas port-to-port established in accordance with Decision 884/2004/EC of the European Parliament and Council of 29 April 2004 amending Decision No 1692/96/EC on Community guidelines for the development of the trans - European transport network to organise sailing traffic, prevent accident and pollution.

value.label: supply
value.definition: Entire range of installations which serve to provide the population of an area with goods and services.

value.label: disposal
value.definition: Discarding of all no usable solid waste from the economic cycle, reprocessing of reusable material or interim storage and hauling to a disposal site for public health and convenience.

value.label: communication
value.definition: communication (voice image etc.) infrastructure

value.label: other infrastructure
value.definition: Other supplementary regulation to infrastructure

value.label: urban reshaping and development area
value.definition: Cities are confronted to both the ageing of their fabric and built-up areas and to changes in their economic functions and in the social characteristics of their population. In order to maintain a harmonious living environment, a buoyant economy and a balanced social structure, a number of public (and sometimes public-private) activities are necessary.

value.label: urban renewal
value.definition: area where impoverished urban neighbourhoods and derelict areas are replaced by large-scale projects related to housing, services, transport systems, recreation areas, etc. Sometimes, the costs of urban renewal for living communities is high and this type of activity is nowadays less frequently carried out than some decades ago

value.label: urban regeneration and revitalisation
value.definition: "Area defined for transforming the obsolete socio-economic base of certain urban areas into a more sustainable socio-economic base through the attraction of new activities and companies, modernisation of the urban fabric, improvement of the urban environment and diversification of the social structure

value.label: urban rehabilitation and restoration
value.definition: area devoted to regenerating and conserving the built heritage or the urban environment, including the ecosystems. In addition to the refurbishment of historical buildings and townscapes, such activities also comprise the modernisation and upgrading of technical facilities and the respect of environmental and security norms and standards.

value.label: commercial development area
value.definition: Area where a commercial development plan applies

value.label: after zoning
value.definition: after the ending of the current zoning the zoning will be forest/nature/housing�

value.label: specific area
value.definition: areas for specific development policies

value.label: derelict area
value.definition: areas which have suffered a significant downturn, with declining or abandoned industries, closed businesses and houses, vacant storefronts, a degraded environment and virtually empty streets at night. Some derelict areas are also contaminated and can be considered as brownfields sites. Derelict areas are a major cause of environmental stress in urban areas

value.label: parking obligation area
value.definition: areas within which the conditions of service by regular public transport can reduce or eliminate the obligations imposed in the realization of parking, especially during the construction of office buildings, or within which the local plan sets a maximum number of parking spaces to achieve during the construction of buildings for other than residential

value.label: demolition provisions areas
value.definition: Areas which provisions relating to the demolition permit exist within

value.label: energy saving area
value.definition: priority perimeter for the development energy saving

value.label: ruling deferring
value.definition: areas within which the competent authority may defer ruling on applications for authorization

value.label: study plan request
value.definition: areas where specific studies must be performed

value.label: social health choices
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to social choices and health protection decided by the responsible authority of the plan(e.g. area reserved with social housing ratios) as defined by the competent authority responsible for the spatial plan

value.label: composition of local residential population
value.definition: Preservation of physical structures and of the specific urban character of an area in order to maintain the composition of the local residential population. Might be adopted to counteract the threat of displacement in an inner-city residential area owing to gentrification.

value.label: publicly subsidised housing area
value.definition: Housing area reserved for dwellings which are subsidized by state or local government for persons and families with low incomes

value.label: regulated activities
value.definition: supplementary regulation related to restricting, permitting or forbidding activities (e.g. area reserved or forbidding commercial activities) or where activities are suitable as defined by the competent authority responsible for the spatial plan

value.label: restricted activities
value.definition: area in which specific activities have restrictions. The NACE code should be used to list the restricted activities

value.label: permitted activities
value.definition: area in which specific activities are permitted the other activities being forbidden. The NACE code should be used to list the permitted activities

value.label: forbidden activities
value.definition: area in which specific activities are forbidden the other activities being permitted. The NACE code should be used to list the forbidden activities

value.label: suitable activities
value.definition: area in which specific activities are suitable. The NACE code should be used to list the suitable activities

value.label: other supplementary regulation
value.definition: Supplementary regulation of other types, not yet listed
